result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrence Oneal Hills

records.addlTxt: Defendant Terrence Oneal Hills not in court, in custody.  Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court for Terrence Oneal Hills.  Attorney Daniel T Flaherty in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties advise case remains on for trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.

Defendant Terrence Oneal Hills not in court, in custody.  Attorney Eugene E. Detert appeared by video for Terrence Oneal Hills.  Attorney Daniel T Flaherty appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held.  Defendant filed prompt disposition. Case set for jury trial and final pretrial dates. Court orders motions in limine filed by 10/26/22 end of business day. Witness lists and any other documents be filed and discovery cut off by the final pretrial date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 4. Case remains set for 10/31 scheduling conference. State to have defendant produced from CJF.
Jury trial scheduled for January 30, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Request for Prompt Disposition Received 10-10-22. - expiration date:2/1/23

Defendant has another case 22CF2094 and filed a request for Prompt Disposition on both cases; parties requested earlier status conference date. Case adjourned for status conference in Branch 04; Attorney Eugene E Detert to appear by zoom. Both parties agreed to date and time, via email. Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Terrence Oneal Hills appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court for Terrence Oneal Hills.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Oak Creek Officer R. Michalski. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Terrence Oneal Hills appeared by video, in custody in MSDF.  Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court in person for Terrence Oneal Hills.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Status Conference. Defense Counsel requests a Preliminary Hearing. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Terrence Oneal Hills appeared by video, in custody in MSDF.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Terrence Oneal Hills
Current: 3240 N 35th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216 United States  (Effective: 08-23-2022)
Prior: 2063 South 5th Place, Milwaukee, WI 53204

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; No Contact Order. If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Terrence Oneal Hills appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Travis Schwantes appeared by video for Terrence Oneal Hills. Prosecuting attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Court ordered no contact with LeNia A C; Thomas J E; Marquita H; and Gary G.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
